org.sd.extract
Class DocText

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.extract.DocText

public class DocText
extends java.lang.Object

Container for text from a document as served through a text container.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Returns:
the non-null but possibly empty text string.

getStrings

getStringWrapper

public StringWrapper getStringWrapper()
Get the default stringWrapper for this text.

Note that the default break strategy is a org.sd.nlp.GeneralBreakStrategy.

getStringWrapper

public StringWrapper getStringWrapper(BreakStrategy breakStrategy)
Get the stringWrapper for this text using the given breakStrategy.

If the breakStrategy is null, then the default GeneralBreakStrategy will be used.

getPathKey

public java.lang.String getPathKey()
Get this text's path key.

The path key is of the form t1.t2....tN, where t1 is the document's root tag name, tN is the xml node's tag name if the xml node contains a tag or the tag path's deepest tag if the xml node is a text node. The remaining t's are the tags leading from t1 to tN.

getPathKey

public java.lang.String getPathKey(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Get this instance's path key with the path to the node in its tree appended.

getCommonData

public XmlLite.Data getCommonData(DocText other)
Get the deepest common data (tag) between this and the other doc texts.

Returns:
the common data (tag) or null if the other is from another document.

hasData

public boolean hasData(XmlLite.Data xmlData)
Determine whether this doc text instance has the given data instance in its tag stack or xml node.

hasExtraction

Determine whether this docText has any extractions.

Returns:
